info.description:
The Patient Access API includes adjudicated claims data, encounters with capitated providers, and clinical data, including laboratory results, formulary information or information about covered outpatient drugs and preferred drug lists must be viewable to the member.

Claims and Encounter data focuses on the FHIR Resources that aligns to CARIN for Blue Button implementation guide based on HL7 FHIR specification, which payers can display to consumers via a FHIR API.
More information on each resource's response attributes may be found in the CARIN for Blue Button HL7 FHIR specification at the link below. 

[https://hl7.org/fhir/us/carin-bb/STU1/index.html](https://hl7.org/fhir/us/carin-bb/STU1/index.html)

Clinical data focuses on the FHIR Resources that represent core clinical information for a patient. The information contained in these Resources are those frequently documented, created or retrieved by healthcare providers during the course of clinical care. Resources generated during the course of diagnostic studies can be found in the Diagnostics Module, whereas the Resources related to medication ordering and administration process can be found in the Medications Module. 

[https://hl7.org/fhir/us/core/STU3.1.1/index.html](https://hl7.org/fhir/us/core/STU3.1.1/index.html)
info.title: Patient Access API

The `US-Core-Location` FHIR [implementation guide](https://hl7.org/fhir/us/core/STU3.1.1/index.html) contains complete details.

Reference the FHIR specification for detailed `US-Core-Location` [attribute descriptions](https://hl7.org/fhir/us/core/STU3.1.1/StructureDefinition-us-core-location-definitions.html) and [sample response](https://hl7.org/fhir/us/core/STU3.1.1/Location-hl7east.json.html)

The `US-Core-DiagnosticReport` FHIR [implementation guide](https://hl7.org/fhir/us/core/STU3.1.1/index.html) contains complete details of the below profiles,


1. US-Core-DiagnosticReport-Note
2. US-Core-DiagnosticReport-Lab

A [US-Core-DiagnosticReport-Note](https://hl7.org/fhir/us/core/STU3.1.1/StructureDefinition-us-core-diagnosticreport-note.html) is the findings and interpretation of diagnostic tests performed on patients, groups of patients, devices, and locations, and/or specimens derived from these. The report includes clinical context such as requesting and provider information, and some mix of atomic results, images, textual and coded interpretations, and formatted representation of diagnostic reports.

Reference the FHIR specification for detailed `US-Core-DiagnosticReport-Note` [attribute descriptions](https://hl7.org/fhir/us/core/STU3.1.1/StructureDefinition-us-core-diagnosticreport-note-definitions.html) and [HL7 Bundle](https://hl7.org/fhir/R4/bundle.html)


A [US-Core-DiagnosticReport-Lab](https://hl7.org/fhir/us/core/STU3.1.1/StructureDefinition-us-core-diagnosticreport-lab.html)  Laboratory results are grouped and summarized using the DiagnosticReport resource which typically reference Observation resource(s). Each Observation resource represents an individual laboratory test and result value or component result values, or a “nested” panel (such as a microbial susceptibility panel) which references other observations. They can also be presented in report form or as free text.

Reference the FHIR specification for detailed `US-Core-DiagnosticReport-Lab` [attribute descriptions](https://hl7.org/fhir/us/core/STU3.1.1/StructureDefinition-us-core-diagnosticreport-lab-definitions.html) and [HL7 Bundle](https://hl7.org/fhir/R4/bundle.html).

Success response will be HL7 `Bundle` with `DiagnosticReport` resource type of `US-Core-DiagnosticReport`.


**Warning:**
Attribute `__id` with value `giztmotwmvzhg2lpnyxtclrshjygc5djmvxhillbmnzs44dsnfzw2ltznvwa` is ***required*** for prototyping only.

A [US-Core-Organization](https://hl7.org/fhir/us/core/STU3.1.1/StructureDefinition-us-core-organization.html) is a formally or informally recognized grouping of people or organizations formed for the purpose of achieving some form of collective action. The [US-Core-PractitionerRole](https://www.hl7.org/fhir/us/core/STU3.1.1/StructureDefinition-us-core-practitionerrole.html) describes details about a provider, which can be a practitioner or an organization. When the provider is a practitioner, there may be a relationship to an organization. A provider renders services to patients at a location. When the provider is a practitioner, there may also be a relationship to an organization. Practitioner participation in healthcare provider insurance networks may be direct or through their role at an organization.

An [US-Core-Immunization](https://www.hl7.org/fhir/us/core/STU3.1.1/StructureDefinition-us-core-immunization.html) describes the event of a patient being administered a vaccine or a record of an immunization as reported by a patient, a clinician or another party. 

The `US-Core-Immunization` FHIR [implementation guide](https://hl7.org/fhir/us/core/STU3.1.1/index.html) contains complete details.

Reference the FHIR specification for detailed `US-Core-Immunization` [attribute descriptions](https://www.hl7.org/fhir/us/core/STU3.1.1/StructureDefinition-us-core-immunization-definitions.html) and [sample response](https://www.hl7.org/fhir/us/core/STU3.1.1/Immunization-imm-1.html).

The `ExplanationOfBenefit` FHIR [implementation guide](https://hl7.org/fhir/us/carin-bb/STU1/index.html) contains complete details of the below profiles,


1. C4BB-ExplanationOfBenefit-Inpatient Institutional
2. C4BB-ExplanationOfBenefit-Outpatient Institutional
3. C4BB-ExplanationOfBenefit-Pharmacy
4. C4BB-ExplanationOfBenefit-Professional NonClinician


A [C4BB-ExplanationOfBenefit-Inpatient Institutional](https://hl7.org/fhir/us/carin-bb/STU1/StructureDefinition-C4BB-ExplanationOfBenefit-Inpatient-Institutional.html) profile is used for Explanation of Benefits (EOBs) based on claims submitted by clinics, hospitals, skilled nursing facilities and other institutions for inpatient services, which may include the use of equipment and supplies, laboratory services, radiology services and other charges. Inpatient claims are submitted for services rendered at an institution as part of an overnight stay. The claims data is based on the institutional claim format UB-04, submission standards adopted by the Department of Health and Human Services.

Reference the FHIR specification for detailed `C4BB-ExplanationOfBenefit-Inpatient Institutional` [attribute descriptions](https://hl7.org/fhir/us/carin-bb/STU1/StructureDefinition-C4BB-ExplanationOfBenefit-Inpatient-Institutional-definitions.html) and [HL7 Bundle](https://hl7.org/fhir/R4/bundle.html).




A [C4BB-ExplanationOfBenefit-Outpatient Institutional](https://hl7.org/fhir/us/carin-bb/STU1/StructureDefinition-C4BB-ExplanationOfBenefit-Outpatient-Institutional.html) profile is used for Explanation of Benefits (EOBs) based on claims submitted by clinics, hospitals, skilled nursing facilities and other institutions for outpatient services, which may include including the use of equipment and supplies, laboratory services, radiology services and other charges. Outpatient claims are submitted for services rendered at a Institutional that are not part of an overnight stay. The claims data is based on the institutional claim form UB-04, submission standards adopted by the Department of Health and Human Services.

Reference the FHIR specification for detailed `C4BB-ExplanationOfBenefit-Outpatient Institutional` [attribute-descriptions](https://hl7.org/fhir/us/carin-bb/STU1/StructureDefinition-C4BB-ExplanationOfBenefit-Outpatient-Institutional-definitions.html) and [HL7 Bundle](https://hl7.org/fhir/R4/bundle.html).




A [C4BB-ExplanationOfBenefit-Pharmacy](https://hl7.org/fhir/us/carin-bb/STU1/StructureDefinition-C4BB-ExplanationOfBenefit-Pharmacy.html) profile is used for Explanation of Benefits (EOBs) based on claims submitted by retail pharmacies. The claims data is based on submission standards adopted by the Department of Health and Human Services defined by NCPDP (National Council for Prescription Drug Program)

Reference the FHIR specification for detailed `C4BB-ExplanationOfBenefit-Pharmacy` [attribute-descriptions](https://hl7.org/fhir/us/carin-bb/STU1/StructureDefinition-C4BB-ExplanationOfBenefit-Pharmacy-definitions.html) and [HL7 Bundle](https://hl7.org/fhir/R4/bundle.html).




A [C4BB-ExplanationOfBenefit-Professional NonClinician](https://hl7.org/fhir/us/carin-bb/STU1/StructureDefinition-C4BB-ExplanationOfBenefit-Professional-NonClinician.html) profile is used for Explanation of Benefits (EOBs) based on claims submitted by physicians, suppliers and other non-institutional providers for professional services. These services may be rendered in inpatient or outpatient, including office locations. The claims data is based on the professional claim form 1500, submission standards adopted by the Department of Health and Human Services as form CMS-1500.

Reference the FHIR specification for detailed `C4BB-ExplanationOfBenefit-Professional NonClinician` [attribute-descriptions](https://hl7.org/fhir/us/carin-bb/STU1/StructureDefinition-C4BB-ExplanationOfBenefit-Professional-NonClinician-definitions.html) and [HL7 Bundle](https://hl7.org/fhir/R4/bundle.html).

Success response will be HL7 `Bundle` with resource type of `ExplanationOfBenefit`.

**Warning:**
Attribute `__id` with value `giztmotwmvzhg2lpnyxtclrshjygc5djmvxhillbmnzs44dsnfzw2ltznvwa` is ***required*** for prototyping only.

A [US-Core-DocumentReference](https://hl7.org/fhir/us/core/STU3.1.1/StructureDefinition-us-core-documentreference.html) resource is used to index a document, clinical note, and other binary objects to make them available to a healthcare system. A document is some sequence of bytes that is identifiable, establishes its own context (e.g., what subject, author, etc. can be displayed to the user), and has defined update management. The DocumentReference resource can be used with any document format that has a recognized mime type and that conforms to this definition.

The `US-Core-DocumentReference` FHIR [Implementation Guide](https://hl7.org/fhir/us/core/STU3.1.1/index.html) contains complete details 

Reference the FHIR specification for detailed `US-Core-DocumentReference` [attribute descriptions](https://hl7.org/fhir/us/core/STU3.1.1/StructureDefinition-us-core-documentreference-definitions.html) and [HL7 Bundle](https://hl7.org/fhir/R4/bundle.html).Success response will be HL7 `Bundle` with `DocumentReference` resource type of `US-Core-DocumentReference`.

A [US-Core-Patient](https://hl7.org/fhir/us/core/STU3.1.1/StructureDefinition-us-core-patient.html) is demographics and other administrative information about an individual or animal receiving care or other health-related services.

The `US-Core-Patient` FHIR [implementation guide](https://hl7.org/fhir/us/core/STU3.1.1/index.html) contains complete details.

A [US-Core-MedicationRequest](https://hl7.org/fhir/us/core/STU3.1.1/StructureDefinition-us-core-medicationrequest.html) is an order or request for both supply of the medication and the instructions for administration of the medication to a patient. The resource is called "MedicationRequest" rather than "MedicationPrescription" or "MedicationOrder" to generalize the use across inpatient and outpatient settings, including care plans, etc., and to harmonize with workflow patterns.

The `US-Core-MedicationRequest` FHIR [implementation guide](https://hl7.org/fhir/us/core/STU3.1.1/index.html) contains complete details.  

Reference the FHIR specification for detailed [US-Core-MedicationRequest](https://hl7.org/fhir/us/core/STU3.1.1/StructureDefinition-us-core-medicationrequest-definitions.html) and  [HL7 Bundle](https://hl7.org/fhir/R4/bundle.html) attribute descriptions. Success response will be HL7 `Bundle` with `MedicationRequest` resource type of `US-Core-MedicationRequest`.

Success response will be HL7 `Bundle` with `Organization` resource type of `US-Core-Organization` or `C4BB-Organization`.

The `Observation` FHIR [implementation guide](https://www.hl7.org/fhir/us/core/STU3.1.1/index.html) contains complete details of the below profiles,


1. US Core Pediatric BMI for Age Observation

3. US Core Pulse Oximetry
4. US Core Smoking Status Observation
5. US Core Laboratory Result Observation
6. US Core Pediatric Head Occipital-frontal Circumference Percentile Profile


The [US Core Pediatric BMI for Age Observation](https://www.hl7.org/fhir/us/core/STU3.1.1/StructureDefinition-pediatric-bmi-for-age.html) profile sets minimum expectations for the Observation resource to record, search, and fetch pediatric body mass index (BMI) per age and gender observations associated with a patient. It is based on the FHIR Vital Signs Profile and identifies the additional mandatory core elements, extensions, vocabularies and value sets which SHALL be present in the Observation resource when using this profile.

Reference the FHIR specification for detailed `US Core Pediatric BMI for Age Observation` [attribute descriptions](https://www.hl7.org/fhir/us/core/STU3.1.1/StructureDefinition-pediatric-bmi-for-age-definitions.html) and [sample response](https://www.hl7.org/fhir/us/core/STU3.1.1/Observation-pediatric-bmi-example.json.html)



The [US Core Pediatric Weight for Height Observation](https://www.hl7.org/fhir/us/core/STU3.1.1/StructureDefinition-pediatric-weight-for-height.html) profile sets minimum expectations for the Observation resource to record, search, and fetch pediatric weight for height and age observations associated with a patient. It is based on the FHIR Vital Signs Profile and identifies the additional mandatory core elements, extensions, vocabularies and value sets which SHALL be present in the Observation resource when using this profile.

Reference the FHIR specification for detailed `US Core Pediatric Weight for Height Observation` [attribute descriptions](https://www.hl7.org/fhir/us/core/STU3.1.1/StructureDefinition-pediatric-weight-for-height-definitions.html) and [sample response](https://www.hl7.org/fhir/us/core/STU3.1.1/Observation-pediatric-wt-example.json.html).




The [US Core Pulse Oximetry](https://www.hl7.org/fhir/us/core/STU3.1.1/StructureDefinition-us-core-pulse-oximetry.html) profile sets minimum expectations for the Observation resource to record, search, and fetch pulse oximetry and inspired oxygen observations associated with a patient. It is based on the FHIR Vital Signs Profile and identifies the additional mandatory core elements, extensions, vocabularies and value sets which SHALL be present in the Observation resource when using this profile.

Reference the FHIR specification for detailed `US Core Pulse Oximetry` [attribute descriptions](https://www.hl7.org/fhir/us/core/STU3.1.1/StructureDefinition-us-core-pulse-oximetry-definitions.html) and [sample response](https://hl7.org/fhir/us/core/STU3.1.1/Observation-satO2-fiO2.json.html).


The [US Core Smoking Status Observation](https://hl7.org/fhir/us/core/STU3.1.1/StructureDefinition-us-core-smokingstatus.html) profile sets minimum expectations for the Observation resource to record, search, and fetch smoking status data associated with a patient. A [US Core Laboratory Result Observation](https://hl7.org/fhir/us/core/STU3.1.1/StructureDefinition-us-core-observation-lab.html) is measurements and simple assertions made about a patient, device or other subject.

Reference the FHIR specification for detailed `US Core Laboratory Result Observation` [attribute descriptions](https://hl7.org/fhir/us/core/STU3.1.1/StructureDefinition-us-core-observation-lab-definitions.html) and [sample response](https://hl7.org/fhir/us/core/STU3.1.1/Observation-blood-glucose.json.html)

The `US-Core-DiagnosticReport` FHIR [implementation guide](https://hl7.org/fhir/us/core/STU3.1.1/index.html) contains complete details of the below profiles,


1. US-Core-DiagnosticReport-Note
2. US-Core-DiagnosticReport-Lab

A [US-Core-DiagnosticReport-Note](https://hl7.org/fhir/us/core/STU3.1.1/StructureDefinition-us-core-diagnosticreport-note.html) is the findings and interpretation of diagnostic tests performed on patients, groups of patients, devices, and locations, and/or specimens derived from these. The report includes clinical context such as requesting and provider information, and some mix of atomic results, images, textual and coded interpretations, and formatted representation of diagnostic reports.

Reference the FHIR specification for detailed `US-Core-DiagnosticReport-Note` [attribute descriptions](https://hl7.org/fhir/us/core/STU3.1.1/StructureDefinition-us-core-diagnosticreport-note-definitions.html) and [sample response](https://hl7.org/fhir/us/core/STU3.1.1/DiagnosticReport-cardiology-report.json.html).

A [US-Core-DiagnosticReport-Lab](https://hl7.org/fhir/us/core/STU3.1.1/StructureDefinition-us-core-diagnosticreport-lab.html) Laboratory results are grouped and summarized using the DiagnosticReport resource which typically reference Observation resource(s). Each Observation resource represents an individual laboratory test and result value or component result values, or a “nested” panel (such as a microbial susceptibility panel) which references other observations. They can also be presented in report form or as free text. 

Reference the FHIR specification for detailed `US-Core-DiagnosticReport-Lab` [attribute descriptions](https://hl7.org/fhir/us/core/STU3.1.1/StructureDefinition-us-core-diagnosticreport-lab-definitions.html) and [sample response](https://hl7.org/fhir/us/core/STU3.1.1/DiagnosticReport-urinalysis.json.html).

A [C4BB-Coverage](https://hl7.org/fhir/us/carin-bb/STU1/StructureDefinition-C4BB-Coverage.html) is the Data that reflect a payer’s coverage that was effective as of the date of service or the date of admission of the claim.

The `C4BB-Coverage` FHIR [implementation guide](https://hl7.org/fhir/us/carin-bb/STU1/index.html) contains complete details.

Reference the FHIR specification for detailed `C4BB-Coverage` [attribute descriptions](https://hl7.org/fhir/us/carin-bb/STU1/StructureDefinition-C4BB-Coverage-definitions.html) and [sample response](https://hl7.org/fhir/us/carin-bb/STU1/Coverage-Coverage1.json.html).

**Warning:**
Attribute `__id` with value `giztmotwmvzhg2lpnyxtclrshjygc5djmvxhillbmnzs44dsnfzw2ltznvwa` is ***required*** for prototyping only.

A [US-Core-Patient](https://hl7.org/fhir/us/core/STU3.1.1/StructureDefinition-us-core-patient.html) is demographics and other administrative information about an individual or animal receiving care or other health-related services.

The `US-Core-Patient` FHIR [implementation guide](https://hl7.org/fhir/us/core/STU3.1.1/index.html) contains complete details.

Reference the FHIR specification for detailed [US-Core-Patient](https://hl7.org/fhir/us/core/STU3.1.1/StructureDefinition-us-core-patient-definitions.html) and [HL7 Bundle](https://hl7.org/fhir/R4/bundle.html) attribute descriptions. 


A [C4BB-Patient](https://hl7.org/fhir/us/carin-bb/STU1/StructureDefinition-C4BB-Patient.html) is used to convey information about the patient who received the services described on the claim.

The `C4BB-Patient` FHIR [implementation guide](https://hl7.org/fhir/us/carin-bb/STU1/index.html) contains complete details.

Reference the FHIR specification for detailed [C4BB-Patient](https://hl7.org/fhir/us/carin-bb/STU1/StructureDefinition-C4BB-Patient-definitions.html) and [HL7 Bundle](https://hl7.org/fhir/R4/bundle.html) attribute descriptions.

Success response will be HL7 `Bundle` with `Patient` resource type of `US-Core-Patient` or `C4BB-Patient`.

**Warning:**
Attribute `__id` with value `gi4tmotwmvzhg2lpnyxtclrqhjbu2u2dnruw42ldmfwe233dnnjwk4twmvzc44dsnfzw2ltznvwa` is ***required*** for prototyping only.

A [US-Core-Procedure](https://www.hl7.org/fhir/us/core/STU3.1.1/StructureDefinition-us-core-procedure.html) action that is or was performed on or for a patient. This can be a physical intervention like an operation, or less invasive like long term services, counseling, or hypnotherapy.

get.description:
The [US-Core-PractitionerRole](https://www.hl7.org/fhir/us/core/STU3.1.1/StructureDefinition-us-core-practitionerrole.html) describes details about a provider, which can be a practitioner or an organization. When the provider is a practitioner, there may be a relationship to an organization. A provider renders services to patients at a location. When the provider is a practitioner, there may also be a relationship to an organization. Practitioner participation in healthcare provider insurance networks may be direct or through their role at an organization.

The `US-Core-PractitionerRole` FHIR [implementation Guide](https://www.hl7.org/fhir/us/core/STU3.1.1/index.html) contains complete details.

Reference the FHIR specification for detailed `US-Core-PractitionerRole` [attribute descriptions](https://www.hl7.org/fhir/us/core/STU3.1.1/StructureDefinition-us-core-practitionerrole-definitions.html) and [sample response](https://www.hl7.org/fhir/us/core/STU3.1.1/Bundle-66c8856b-ba11-4876-8aa8-467aad8c11a2.json.html).

**Warning:**
Attribute `__id` with value `giztmotwmvzhg2lpnyxtclrshjygc5djmvxhillbmnzs44dsnfzw2ltznvwa` is ***required*** for prototyping only.

A [US-Core-DocumentReference](https://hl7.org/fhir/us/core/STU3.1.1/StructureDefinition-us-core-documentreference.html) resource is used to index a document, clinical note, and other binary objects to make them available to a healthcare system. A document is some sequence of bytes that is identifiable, establishes its own context (e.g., what subject, author, etc. can be displayed to the user), and has defined update management. The DocumentReference resource can be used with any document format that has a recognized mime type and that conforms to this definition.

The `US-Core-DocumentReference` FHIR [Implementation Guide](https://hl7.org/fhir/us/core/STU3.1.1/index.html) contains complete details.  

Reference the FHIR specification for detailed `US-Core-DocumentReference` [attribute descriptions](https://hl7.org/fhir/us/core/STU3.1.1/StructureDefinition-us-core-documentreference-definitions.html) and [sample response](https://hl7.org/fhir/us/core/STU3.1.1/DocumentReference-episode-summary.json.html#).

**Warning:**
Attribute `__id` with value `giztmotwmvzhg2lpnyxtclrshjygc5djmvxhillbmnzs44dsnfzw2ltznvwa` is ***required*** for prototyping only.
